alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 8:58AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern Sonoma County in northern California. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 856 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain in northern Sonoma County. Widespread 1 to 2 inch rainfall totals have been reported this morning in this area, with reports of minor flooding beginning to come in. Urban and small stream flooding is expected to continue for the next couple of hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Windsor, Healdsburg, Cloverdale, Guerneville and Monte Rio. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
